intro: Monotes rufotomentosus, commonly known as the red-tomentose monotes, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
